action.primary: Relieves toxicity (Purges Fire), dries Dampness, kills parasites and alleviates itching

indications: External wash for Damp-Heat rashes (scabies, tinea)

action.primary: Restrains and inhibits sores, generates flesh and transforms putrefication

indications: Topically for problems where toxins and pathogens have collected and clogged the channels, collaterals and muscles leading to blockage and Stagnation
Chronic diarrhea, hemafecia, uterine bleeding and vaginal discharge
Topically for epistaxis, hemorrhoidal bleeding, bleeding gums and bleeding due to external trauma
Wind-Phlegm (Heat) disorders with irritability, delirium, and convulsions
Cough with sputum that is difficult to expectorate

contraindications: Contraindicated in those with a weak digestive system.
Contraindicated in those with no Damp-Heat.
Contraindicated in those with Yin Deficiency with Internal Heat and Fire Blazing with sore throat.
Contraindicated in those with eye pain from Yin Deficiency and Blood Heat.

useCases: As an external wash for chronic vaginal discharge with itching and eczema.
As a wash for genital itching due to vaginal candidiasis in women.
Intense itching of eczema, damp scrotum and other pruritic disorders.
External wash for eczema.
As a paste with concentrated tea for Wind-Damp-Heat toxin in the muscles and skin with severe itching that results in a yellow exudate after scratching.
Topically as a powder for scabies.
As a sitz bath for profuse vaginal discharge and itching from Damp-Heat pouring downward.
Intestinal parasites.
Topically for developing fistulas.
Topically for non-healing ulcers.
Topically for sores of the mouth and ears.
Redness, swelling and pain of middle and outer ear.
Internally and topically for epistaxis, hemoptysis, upper gastrointestinal bleeding or bleeding from trauma.
Internally as a powder for chronic, recalcitrant diarrhea in the elderly.
Continuous uterine bleeding.
As an enema for the Phlegm Collapse type of Wind-Stroke.
Irritability, delirium, and convulsions with accompanying gurgling in the throat.
Jaundice.
Swelling without pus or suppuration.
Chronic diarrhea or dysentery.
Wind-Phlegm disorders.

notes: It is almost always applied topically because of its strong action on tissues.
Overdose can cause ulceration, vomiting, diarrhea and shock.
This substance has been shown to have an inhibitory effect on the growth of cancer cells.
It is used as a hemostatic and analgesic for healing wounds and promoting granulation.
It is used internally as an astringent and externally for skin conditions.
It is used in small amounts for infantile spasms.
It is said to cure carbuncles, cellulitis, furuncles and malignant boils.
It is used as a purgative to clean the Stomach and Intestines
It is made into boluses with wax to treat pyogenic infections.
For swelling and rigidity of the tongue, powder equal parts of this herb and Arillus Longan Long Yan Rou and place under the tongue.
To relieve vulvar pain, parch and powder 3 parts Ming Fan and 1.5 parts Rx. Glycyrrhizae #{GanCao} Gan Cao wrap in a piece of cloth and apply topically.

Both Bai Fan and Catechu #{ErCha} Er Cha drains Dampness and absorb seepage. Bai Fan resolves toxicity kills parasites, dries Dampness and alleviates itching and is primarily used for Dampness. Er Cha but is more transformational and can be used for sores that are filled with purulent fluid and chronic non-healing sores. It also stops bleeding due to external trauma.

Dried Alumen, Alumen Dehydratum Ku Fan has reduced sour and cold properties with an enhanced ability to restrain and inhibit sores, generate flesh, stop diarrhea and bleeding and transform putrefication and is the form most commonly used externally for sores and abscesses, oral sores, or eye problems. It is prepared so that it is light, spongy, and not translucent.
